title: Computational Thinking-Integrated Project-Based Course for Social Studies Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of core social studies concepts and digital tool utilization experience
context.additional_context: Acquiring Practical Methods for Current Social Studies Teachers to Integrate Computational Thinking into Instruction

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze social studies data to identify patterns and codify interpreted results
Apply computational thinking procedures (decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, algorithm design) to solving social studies problems
Learners can visualize social studies data using digital tools and explain the problem-solving process to peers.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
